Apollo Buttons

Apollo Button Overview

A button indicates a possible user action. Apollo buttons feature clean, crisp edges. The rectangular button conveys Apollo's precise and efficient qualities. The floating nature of the hover state gives focus to the task. The reverb click animation gives users visual feedback in an Apollo way.

Buttons come in three versions. Primary and secondary are used to indicate priority in call to actions, such as "save" and "cancel". The Link style button is designed to be used alongside a primary or secondary button when the secondary action needs to be de-emphasized.

Each of the states shown here are triggered by native pseudo-classes, like :hover, :disabled. Utility classes (.hover, .disabled) are also available to apply the same styling if pseudo-classes don't work.

Default state
Hover
Active
Disabled
Button Variants

Use any of the available button classes to quickly create a styled button.

Primary action
Secondary action
Link style
Disabled styling

When actions are disabled, you can apply.

Disabled button
Disabled anchor
Edit
Button Sizes

Large and small size options are available to use. A large button works well for a prominent call to action, while small buttons are suited for use inside a table where space is limited. Block-level buttons are full-width and can be combined with small or large button styles.

Large
Small
Full-width
